description:
Year 198 of the Solar Era in Tokyo, special fire brigades are fighting against a phenomenon called spontaneous human combustion where human beings are turned into living infernos called "Infernals.” While the Infernals are first-generation cases of spontaneous human combustion, later generations possess the ability to manipulate flames while retaining human form. Shinra Kusakabe, a youth who gained the nickname Devil’s Footprints for his ability to ignite his feet at will, joins the Special Fire Force Company 8 which composes of other flames users as they work to extinguish any Infernals they encounter. As a faction that is creating Infernals appears, Shinra begins to uncover the truth behind a mysterious fire that caused the death of his family twelve years ago.

(Source: Official Website)
synonyms: หน่วยผจญคนไฟลุก

tags.name: Firefighters
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of rescuers specialised in firefighting.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Rescue
tags.description: Centers around operations that carry out urgent treatment of injuries, remove people from danger, or save lives. This includes series that are about search-and-rescue teams, trauma surgeons, firefighters, and more.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Atsushi_Ohkubo) | [Official Website](http://ameblo.jp/atsushi-ohkubo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSYlewtVNXpHDw24YYP-Gzw)

He was the assistant of [Rando Ayamine](https://anilist.co/staff/96887/Rando-Ayamine) on the manga series [GetBackers](https://anilist.co/anime/132/GetBackers/).
[Yoshiki Tonogai](https://anilist.co/staff/97918/Yoshiki-Tonogai), [Takuji Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/99906/Takuji-Katou), [Takatoshi Shiozawa](https://anilist.co/staff/100604/Takatoshi-Shiozawa), [Tomoyuki Maru](https://anilist.co/staff/106881/Maru-Tomoyuki), and [Kei Urana](https://anilist.co/staff/263766/Kei-Urana) were once assistants.

Yuuki Yase is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He joined Satelight in 2005 as a production manager. In 2010, Yase joined Shaft as an episode director, and made his series directorial debut with Hidamari Sketch x Honeycomb. He left Shaft in 2018, and is currently freelance.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

Yuuki Yase is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He joined Satelight in 2005 as a production manager. In 2010, Yase joined Shaft as an episode director, and made his series directorial debut with Hidamari Sketch x Honeycomb. He left Shaft in 2018, and is currently freelance.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/konnotato) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2297808)

A freelance illustrator and animator. After graduating from Seian University of Art and Design's Japanese-style Painting course, he joined Shaft. There, he did in-between animation for the Puella Magi Madoka Magica movies and the Monogatari series, as well as key animation for Monogatari Second Season and Mekakucity Actors. After leaving Shaft, he worked on Fate/Grand Order Absolute Demonic Front: Babylonia as an animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/konnotato) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2297808)

A freelance illustrator and animator. After graduating from Seian University of Art and Design's Japanese-style Painting course, he joined Shaft. There, he did in-between animation for the Puella Magi Madoka Magica movies and the Monogatari series, as well as key animation for Monogatari Second Season and Mekakucity Actors. After leaving Shaft, he worked on Fate/Grand Order Absolute Demonic Front: Babylonia as an animation director.

Yuuki Yase is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He joined Satelight in 2005 as a production manager. In 2010, Yase joined Shaft as an episode director, and made his series directorial debut with Hidamari Sketch x Honeycomb. He left Shaft in 2018, and is currently freelance.
